citing_paper_authors: Oscar, Täckström | Ryan, McDonald | Jakob, Uszkoreit
raw_text: Unsupervised methods attempt to infer linguistic structure without using any annotated data (Klein and Manning, 2004) or possibly by using a set of linguistically motivated rules (Naseem et al, 2010) or a linguistically informed model structure (Berg-Kirkpatrick and Klein, 2010) .The aim of transfer methods is instead to use knowledge induced from labeled resources in one or mo resource languages to construct systems for target languages in which no or few such resources are avail able (Hwa et al, 2005)
clean_text: Unsupervised methods attempt to infer linguistic structure without using any annotated data (Klein and Manning, 2004) or possibly by using a set of linguistically motivated rules (Naseem et al, 2010) or a linguistically informed model structure (Berg-Kirkpatrick and Klein, 2010).
